 TextFormat ()

Detailed Description

Describes the format of a text. The type of the horizontal and vertical alignment can be set and it's also possible to specify text attributes like underlined, italic or bold.

Member Typedef Documentation

typedef UINT8 TextFormat::TextAttr
 

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum TextFormat::FontAlign
 

Defines the vertical text alignment (Top, Baseline or Bottom).

Enumerator:
Top  The given y coordinate is represented by the top border of the font.
Baseline  The given y coordinate is represented by the baseline of the font.
Bottom  The given y coordinate is represented by the bottom border of the font.

enum TextFormat::TextAlign
 

Defines the horizontal text alignment (Left, Centered or Right).

Enumerator:
Default  Alignment is corresponding to the used language (usually this means left-aligned).
Left  The text will be aligned on the left side.
Centered  The text will be horizontally centered.
Right  The Text will be aligned on the right side.

enum TextFormat::TextAttrValues
 

Defines attributes for text output. Note: not all fonts must support any text attribute. Combinations of text attributes can be defined using the bitwise or operator. If a font does not support an attribute (e. g. bold or italic) APOXI tries to emulate the attribute.

Enumerator:
Normal 
Underlined 
Italic 
Bold 
Strikethrough 

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

TextFormat::TextFormat (   ) 
 

If the default constructor is used, the parameters have to be provided by using the method Init.

TextFormat::TextFormat (  INT  system_font_id,
TextAlign  text_align = Default,
TextAttr  text_attr = TextFormat::Normal,
FontAlign  font_align = Top
) 
 

Parameters:
system_font_id ID of the system-font (e. g. Font::Client). Using a system-font instead of a font-reference has the benefit that a system-font may automatically change when a theme or a language has been changed.
text_align Alignment of the text (Default, Left, Centered or Right).
text_attr Attribute of the text (Normal, Underlined, Italic, Bold and/or Strikethrough).
font_align Font alignment (Top, Baseline or Bottom).

TextFormat::TextFormat (  const Font &  font,
TextAlign  text_align = Default,
TextAttr  text_attr = TextFormat::Normal,
FontAlign  font_align = Top
) 
 

Parameters:
system_font_id Reference to a font (e. g. use FontConfig::GetFont(0)). when a theme or a language has been changed.
text_align Alignment of the text (Default, Left, Centered or Right).
text_attr Attribute of the text (Normal, Underlined, Italic, Bold and/or Strikethrough).
font_align Font alignment (Top, Baseline or Bottom).

Member Function Documentation

const Font & TextFormat::GetFont (   )  const
 

Returns a reference to the specified font. If the font has been set by specifying a system-font (e. g. SetFont(Font::Client)) the returned font-reference might differ dependant from the current set language and theme.

BOOLEAN TextFormat::operator== (  const TextFormat &  text_format  )  const
 

void TextFormat::SetFont (  INT  system_font_id  ) 
 

Sets the font by specifying a system-font (e. g. Font::Client). Using a system-font instead of a font-reference has the benefit that a system-font may automatically change when a theme or a language has been changed.

void TextFormat::SetFont (  const Font &  font  ) 
 

Sets to font of the textformat to the given font. In opposite to SetFont(INT system_font_id) the font won't be changed if a theme or a language has been changed.

void TextFormat::SetFontAlign (  FontAlign  font_align  )  [inline]
 

Sets the font alignment (Top, Baseline or Bottom).

BOOLEAN TextFormat::SetProperty (  ResourceParser &  parser,
const GuiObjectFactory::PropertyId  prop_id
) 
 

Initializes the instance by reading out a resource file generated by ARAGON. This method may not be invoked by the MMI in a direct manner and might be changed in future releases.

void TextFormat::SetTextAlign (  TextAlign  text_align  )  [inline]
 

Sets the text alignment (Top, Baseline or Bottom).

void TextFormat::SetTextAttr (  TextAttr  text_attr  )  [inline]
 

Sets the attributes of the text (Normal, Underlined, Italic, Bold, Strikethrough). Setting two attributes at the same time can be done the following way: text_format.SetTextAttr(TextFormat::Italic | TextFormat::Bold);
